TEXT: The applicant , Mr Todor Stanislavov Deyanov , is a NORP national who was born in DATE and lives in GPE .

On DATE the applicant requested that ORG of GPE initiate proceedings before ORG and seek a ruling as to the constitutionality of section CARDINAL ) of ORG ( see “ Relevant domestic law ” below ) , in so far as it concerned non - profit organisations . He argued that that provision encroached upon the right to freedom of association guaranteed by the LAW and international law .
On DATE the applicant forwarded identical requests to ORG and ORG . On DATE he forwarded an identical request to the Ombudsman .

By letter dated DATE the President of ORG informed the applicant that the action requested was not within his powers . The ORG replied on DATE , informing the applicant that he did not consider section CARDINAL(CARDINAL)(CARDINAL ) of ORG to be unconstitutional . ORG replied on DATE , also considering that the disputed provision did not contravene the LAW .

On DATE the applicant lodged new requests with the ORG and ORG to initiate proceedings before ORG . He reiterated his position that section CARDINAL ) of ORG impinged upon the right to freedom of association . In addition , he challenged section CARDINAL of the same LAW , in so far as it provided that the police “ represented society as a whole ” . He received no reply .

On DATE the applicant wrote directly to ORG , requesting that it initiate proceedings and examine the constitutionality of the CARDINAL above - mentioned provisions of ORG . This request was refused , as LAW paragraph CARDINAL of LAW does not entitle citizens to lodge constitutional complaints . The applicant was informed of the refusal on DATE .
ORG came into force on DATE .

Its section CARDINAL , as enacted , provided that in the performance of their duties the officials of ORG were to “ represent society as a whole ” . In DATE the text of section CARDINAL was amended and this phrase was repealed .
Section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) of the LAW provides that police operations can be carried out through :

CARDINAL . [ S]etting up and using non - profit organisations or companies , subject to the conditions set out in law , to cover up the investigation by an undercover agent or to conduct undercover operations ... ” .

The formation , registration and activities of non - profit organisations are governed by ORG . Its section CARDINAL provides that those organisations are free to define the goals they wish to pursue , which are to be stated in their articles of association .

Article CARDINAL paragraphs CARDINAL and QUANTITY certain ORG bodies , including ORG , ORG , ORG and the ORG to initiate proceedings before ORG in order to obtain a ruling as to the constitutionality of statutes adopted by ORG . ORG do not have the right to lodge a constitutional complaint .
